page.title: 10Water Supply _ Handois
page.content: Jersey's dense population makes a very heavy demand on the limited water supply. Water catchment is limited to four of five narrow valleys with a stream running along its base. One such valley is known as Waterworks Valley in the parish of St. Lawrence. It has three small reservoirs, Handois being the most northerly one along this picturesque valley. It also acts as a pumping and filtration station within the overall system. It also boasts a trout hatchery to provide the reservoirs with their pollution early warning system. In 1985 the States of Jersey are still debating after about five years whether there is a need to flood yet another valley in the east of the Island, called Queen's Valley.
